intro: Justicia phillipsiae, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators like hummingbirds and bees. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The botanical name honors the English botanist John Phillips, who contributed to the study of tropical plants.
